headline: Occidental Petroleum (OXY) Is Up 5.7% After OxyChem Sale And Debt Paydown Pivot - Has The Bull Case Changed?
summary: In January, Occidental Petroleum completed the sale of its former chemicals business, OxyChem, to Berkshire Hathaway and earmarked US$6.50 billion of the proceeds to pay down debt, while also revising its Delaware Basin natural gas gathering contract to a fixed-fee structure to cut costs and increase flexibility. These moves mark a meaningful reshaping of Occidental’s portfolio and balance sheet, potentially giving the company more room to manage future commodity cycles and capital...
